poem:
Rewriting Scenes

In Luton, shadows stretch long and lean,  
a blade's glint rewriting endings unseen.  
Youthful voices sharpened by the past,  
each street corner a stage, danger cast.  
In drama class, pens outrun fear's sway,  
on paper, knives are tucked safely away.  
The curtain rises—hope plays its part,  
in this city, on its uncertain heart.
